description: I have been a registered user of Moneydance for ten years. They have been continuously improving their product over that time. This program is the best multi-platform home accounting program there is. It is the biggest reason my wife was willing make the switch to Linux back in 2009. It will sync with multiple devices on both home network and cloud. You should have no problem getting started with this program but it does have a lot of features and some will require a knowledge of linux.
do not know, it will not launch

I installed the snap version of this application, and I wasn't able to start it : "Error: Could not find or load main class com.moneydance.apps.md.controller.Main
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.moneydance.apps.md.controller.Main
"
Flashes a terminal window then nothing. Does not appear in list of installed applications.

Based on problems other reviewers were having, I downloaded the deb file from the Moneydance website and it installed and opened fine. It does cost $50 (USD) and only has 100 transactions in the demo. I haven't decided if I want to buy it or not.

description: with my current double monitor configuration, everythng displays fine but MoneyDance is too small to read.
Installed it, then tried to launch it. A window flickers and then nothing happens.
Looks like it doesn't handle its dependencies properly.

I've been a registered MoneyDance user for a couple of years now and came across MoneyDance when searching for a Quicken replacement. I haven't tried this download, rathe I've downloaded the software directly from the Infinite Kind website and have not had any problems with it.
Under Ubuntu 19.1, attempting to launch the program results in an instance of terminal opening briefly, displaying nothing within, then disappearing. After which -- nothing happens at all.

Knocking off 1 star for the bad Snap.

Have used Moneydance for years, Linux, Mac, and Windows and I really like it.

Still has the same error Jonas called out in May 2019:

Error: Could not find or load main class com.moneydance.apps.md.controller.Main
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.moneydance.apps.md.controller.Main

Pity, I really wanted this to work but oh well!

I've reported the bad Snap to the publisher The Infinite Kind, we will see if they fix it. Went to the Moneydance site, downloaded the deb, and that installed perfiectly. Tells me its a bad Snap and not Ubuntu 20.04 Daily Build.
summary: Moneydance is great but this Snap is busted

description: I tried 3 finance snaps, two failed and one wanted to send data to the internet. Complete failure, because the last thing I would accept from any finance program is, that it would send data to the Internet.
do not appear on installed app not even on search

I’ve read a lot of comments about Moneydance not installing under Ubuntu 20.04.

If you are having problems try this :- 

get the software from:- https://infinitekind.com/download-moneydance-personal-finance-software


Use Terminal to install package with the simple command below. (This assumes you downloaded to the default Download folder)


 sudo dpkg -i Downloads/moneydance_linux_amd64.deb

I've been looking for years for a good app to replace Quicken. Nothing really seemed to do the job. MoneyDance was the smoothest of all the transitions I attempted, and it does everything I need.

At first I was annoyed that MoneyDance doesn't automatically download my bank transactions until I learned that the only reason Quicken was able to do that is that it maintained my login information on their servers. I'm more than happy to download manually instead.
Can't find it after install. Needs work.

The installation from the SnapStore does not work. However I went to their webiste and installed the downloadeble .deb file.
Keep in mind this is not a free application but offers a trial version that allows 100 free transactons.
I see myself using this for the foreseeable future.
summary: Good app, will update this review after some more testing

description: I've been using Moneydance for years and it's fantastic software. However, this snap doesn't work. Even if it installs, it does not launch.
summary: Moneydance is great, this Snap is not

description: I am a little surprised to see the posts saying there were problems getting the program to work. I am new to Linux, and it worked for me right away. I exported my file from the Windows version and imported it just fine. There are many online alternatives to this tool -- aggregators like Mint and Personal Capital, for instance. But, they don't provide long-term historical data. I've used Moneydance for over 10 years. It does great on tracking investments, checking and savings, loans, and assets. I would encourage anyone looking for a personal finance tool to consider it. And especially don't be swayed by comparisons to aggregators... consider the long-term difference I mentioned before. That's huge. So many times it has saved me... like... if I need to know the exact date I purchased an item... even if it was 5 years ago... and the fact that my ENTIRE investment history is saved. To me, this program is essential.
summary: I've Used in on Mac, Windows, and Now Linux (Ubuntu)

description:
Many years ago, when I still had a Windows desktop, I used to use MS Money to manage my finances.  It's one of the few MS products that I liked.

Today, especially on Linux, I thought that functionality was gone. Moneydance takes care of my finances, allows me to do a budget, project cash flow and debt into the future, keep track of recurring bills, manage my investments; in short, everything I need. 

Moneydance has become a central part of my life and bonus, it requires me to share nothing to the cloud or any third parties. I sync to Dropbox, to an encrypted file.

I didn't install via Snap. I'm not really a fan of Snap. I downloaded and installed from the provided deb package.
terminal opens briefly with an error message. goes away before I can read it. :P
Does everything I need, 5 stars
nice try -waste of time

When I decided to make Ubuntu my daily driver after moving on from Windows, I tried a number of options to manage my chequing account activity. Moneydance was the best option for me and I'm now very happy with it.

I don't use any of the automated data aquisition because none of the banks I deal with in Canada seem to be supported. As a result I can't comment on that, but for my purposes, it works very well.
summary: Excellent for tracking and balancing bank activity

description: I am a long time user of this program and have previously downloaded from the MoneyDance.com website. Setting up a new laptop, I thought I would download it here instead. The install does not work. Please fix it or remove it from the store.
summary: Great Program. Install Does Not Work

description: When I press the launch button nothing happens, it didn't even get to the point of putting an icon in the software area.
summary: doesn't even install properly - no icon

description:
I agree with other reviewers. Even though the computer went through the motions, I found that nothing appeared to download. The download process went through a couple of jerky restarts at the 29% mark, but then supposedly completed the install. However, no program or icon ever seemed to be present. 
   Why have an entry when nothing seems to happen, except another method to waste time?
   I gave it one star only because the system would not allow a no star vote.
summary: Is there an app to download in the first place?

Application simple et peu cher. Disponible sur plusieurs OS et intuitif à utiliser. N'importe qui dans ma famille est en mesure de faire les fonctions basiques. Franchement, sur Linux ou autres plateformes, je n'ai pas trouvé mieux. Il n'est pas parfais, mais plus près du 5 étoiles que 4 !
